definition: to resign a government post
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
surname Guan
government official/governmental/official/public/organ of the body/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The reason of WANG Ting-gui resignation and retiremen lie wrong understanding in later generations.
sentences.chinese: 对于王庭珪辞官归隐的原因，后人存在错误的认识。

sentences.english: Which ancient Chinese government official resigned because he refused to bow for five bushels of grain?
sentences.chinese: 因“不为五斗米而折腰”而辞官的是以下哪一位？

sentences.english: He has hibernated for several years.
sentences.chinese: 他已经辞官退隐好多年了。

definition: to retire from a government post (old)
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
to take up an official post
to request permission to resign from an official position (old)
to take an official post/to become a government employee
to go into mourning for one's parents
to remove armor and return to the farm/to return to civilian life
to return home/fig. to retire from public life
demotion/to have one's job cut
to ask sb to resign from a post
to demote an official/a demoted official
to lead a quiet and peaceful life in retirement/to stay home with nothing to do/to lead a solitary life
court/imperial household/dynasty
to receive an imperial command
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
demotion to commoner (idiom)
